fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using a Kanban board, Portfolio will always assign at most 1 story per person per day, the exception for that is only when more than one story could be completed at the same day. The issue with this is that if an user is assigned, for example, a 32 work hour per week capacity (6.4h per day), Portfolio might skip almost full days if the rest of a story takes, let's say, 1h of that day to be finished, and there is no other story that is estimated for less than 5.4,  Portfolio skips the full 5.4h capacity of that day and the next story is only starting on the next day, stretching the scope plan and not using the full capacity as some might expect.

h3. Affects
Any version until now, it was tested on 2.24.0.

h3. Description of the problem
Let's say you have your Plan has a Kanban board configured with estimation in days, 8 working hours per day, 5 days per week, and a user is assigned several stories, with a 32 work hours per week for that user.

h3. Expected
It might be expected to visualize consistent 4 days per week (32 hours as that user capacity) of work looking at the Capacity view of the Portfolio plan until the end of the scope planning. 

h3. Current behaviour
Jira shows inconsistent capacity estimation per days or hours (if you configured estimation in hours) per week, for example, 4 days in the first week, 3.6 days in the second week, 2.3 days in the third week and so on.

That happens because, let's say the biggest story has a 40 hours estimation. That story will take 6 full days (38.4 hours as Portfolio ignores the 8 hour working day and assumes a 6.4 hour working day because 32h/5d per week = 6.4) and 1.6 hours of the 7th day. The 7th day will still have 4.8 hours of capacity considering the 6.4 work hours for that user, however, if there is no story estimated less than 4.8 hours, Portfolio will skip the whole 4.8 hours of that day, and start the next story on the next working day.
That makes the capacity view show the following:
Week 1: 4 days (full 32h worked on one story)
Week 2: The 5th and 6th day are worked full 6.4 capacity as it is still the first story being worked on, but on the 7th day the plan only estimate 1.6 hours of that day capacity, going directly to the 8th day for the next story, leaving free capacity for no reason.

h3. Additional information
It works well if you set 40 work hours for the user as Portfolio will always estimate full days. The issue here is that Portfolio ignores the 8 working hours per day configured in the plan settings and use 6.4 instead automatically.

h3. Workaround
1) Always fill all the capacity in the case when weekly capacity is 32h, someone would need to estimate always in hours and the estimate values should  be always dividable by 6.4h
or
2) Exclude one of the working days, let's say Friday, having only 4 working days per week. That way Portfolio will correctly fulfill the capacity for a 32 work hour agent when estimating per days.
fields.summary: Allow Portfolio to schedule stories into days if any capacity is available on Kanban

fields.description:
Currently, whenever an user with assigned issues on Portfolio is inactivated, he is automatically unassigned of any issues within Portfolio's plan and cannot be assigned issues until it is re-activated.

It would be better if there was an option in Portfolio to control this behaviour instead.
fields.summary: Allow portfolio to not automatically unassign inactive users issues

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

At this moment, it is giving users permission to *Edit a Plan* (i.e link Epics to initiatives, releases, estimate issues etc ), will also grant the ability to *Create new plans.* An admin can also give *Portfolio-ReadOnly* permission at the global level and *Editors permission* at the plan level, but with that the user is not able to link issues to Epics. The plan permissions can only be able used to further refine the global permissions and not to overwrite them.
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide a possibility to admins to give Edit permissions (ability to do work within a plan) without giving the ability to Create/Modify plan configurations.
h3. Why this is important

On large instance with thousands of users, it is hard to control the number of Plans that get created. Hence it is important that Jira permissions are set appropriately to control the number of users that can create plans.
fields.summary: As an administrator, I would like to give users the ability to work within a plan and without the ability to create/modify plan configurations

Also, It is hard to set the value "d/MMM/yy" to Jira because it is contain of global configuration.

 

I am so happy if you add date format configuration in the portfolio for Jira.

Currently, when a user select a version from the Release drop-down menu, only issues with the chosen fix version will be displayed. User would like all issues under parent task is shown when they select version option which is set for the parent task.


h3. Suggested Solution

h3. Workaround 

None

+New Experience+

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If a plan's issue source is updated by a user that doesn't have access to a specific project, when the issue source is updated again by another user that has access to that project, all releases in the project will be automatically selected, despite some being omitted the first time the plan was created.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# As user A, create a plan and select issue source from project A
# Assuming project A has 5 releases, select only 1 for the plan
# As user B that doesn't have access to project A (no Browse Projects permission), edit the plan's issue source without basically changing anything
# As user A, edit the plan's issue source again and notice that all the 5 releases are automatically selected

h3. Expected behavior
Only the original release should be selected. The rest should remain deselected.

h3. Notes
* This seems to only happen when different users edit the issue source of the same plan alternately
* In case of a more complex scenario e.g. the issue source includes multiple projects with a lot more releases, it's easy to include unwanted releases in an unexpected manner
fields.summary: All releases are unexpectedly selected when issue source is updated

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Searching for the "Parent Link" field using either "IS EMPTY" or "IS NOT EMPTY" returns an incorrect result.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

While having Portfolio active, do the following search:
{code:java}
"Parent Link" is EMPTY
{code}
_Or_
{code:java}
"Parent Link" is not EMPTY
{code}
h3. Expected Behavior
 * For *is EMPTY*, only issues without a Parent Link should be returned
 * For *is not EMPTY*, only issues with a Parent Link should be returned

h3. Actual Behavior

The results are returned in an _unexplainable_ way, e.g. issues *_without_* a Parent Link appear in *is not EMPTY* and do not appear in *is EMPTY*.
h3. Note

The results of the 2 JQLs seem to be complements of each other. For example:
 * There're 100 issues, only 5 of which have a Parent Link
 * If *is not EMPTY* returns 20 (or any other number instead of 5)
 * Then *is EMPTY* returns the other 80

h3. Workaround

As introduced by this comment on Feb 5, 2020:
 Parent Link is not EMPTY considers 3 types of "parent links": Parent Link from Portfolio, Epics and subtasks. To search issues with only the Parent Link custom field present, exclude the other possible links:
{code:java}
"Parent Link" is not EMPTY AND "Epic Link" is EMPTY
{code}
And to further exclude subtasks, if needed:
{code:java}
"Parent Link" is not EMPTY AND "Epic Link" is EMPTY AND issuetype in standardIssueTypes()
{code}
h3. Root cause

This happens because the "Parent Link" search keyword is an abstraction of parent links, going beyond the actual custom field with that name.
 JPOSERVER-2734 has been created to {{Change the "Parent Link" search keyword so it doesn't conflict with the "Parent Link" custom field}}.
fields.summary: Parent Link JQL does not work with EMPTY keyword

fields.description:
Could Portfolio for Jira have the ability to import user data and availability from an external source? For example if a company has all their user data, including availability (e.g. annual leave) in a separate system/db, could there be a way to import this data into Portfolio for JIRA? 

You could import into Portfolio for Jira a list of users, their standard working week hours, the days they are unavailable (e.g. annual leave) and also the team that they are associated with.  

This feature would mean users would not need to manually enter this data into two separate systems.
fields.summary: Import User availability data from external source

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, if the *Parent link* field is exposed to issues in issue page, user can add any issue including those outside Portfolio plan to use the parent link.

User would like to limit the option available to the options available in the *Parent link* field so the options will only be available to the issues which are available in the same Portfolio plan as the parent issue.


h3. Suggested Solution

limit the option available to the options available in the *Parent link* field so the options will only be available to the issues which are available in the same Portfolio plan as the parent issue.


h3. Workaround 

None. To prevent users from adding undesired issues to the parent issue, remove "Parent link" from issue page and link issues to the Parent issue from Portfolio plan.
fields.summary: Limit *Parent link* option to specific project

fields.description:
h4. Summary
Portfolio for JIRA always treats any issue link as Dependency

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Hierarchy is set to 
{code}
Initiative - Goal - Epic - Story - Subtask
{code}
# Create issues following the hierarchy
!plan1.png|thumbnail!
# Set issue link between Initiative and Goal in JIRA's side

h4. Expected Behavior
Portfolio should not treat it as dependency, as issue link in JIRA can have different usage/context for the users (who is not necessarily working on Portfolio Plan). Having dependency to be automatically translated as issue link in JIRA is fine, but not necessarily the other way around. As the issue link usage in JIRA is broader.  
Example of use case:
{quote}
In this use case; only some roles like Product-Owner, Scrum-Master, Release-Manager are working with Portfolio. But the other roles (such as developer, tester, designer) in the business unit are working with issues (stories, epics...) on JIRA's side or board. Therefore most of these roles (developer, tester, designer) will be using issue links on their Epic and/or tasks
{quote}

h4. Actual Result
Portfolio treats it as dependency. And the example (from steps to reproduce) will result in having dependency within the same hierarchy, and that can result in cyclic dependency when those issues being scheduled. 

Note on cyclic dependency
{quote}
The general rule is that Live plan’s algorithm bases itself on the Story level as it contains the actual work and everything else is just a helpful structure. In this case, the properties below or above are transferred back to the story level/or the most bottom level. So setting dependency within the same parent/child tree line results in cyclic dependencies.
{quote}
fields.summary: Portfolio treats any issue link in JIRA as dependency in Plan

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Issue is missing from Plan after setting the "Parent field" in issue page.

+Steps to reproduce+

# Edit a plan source and ensure that it excludes both "Issues without parent Initiative" and "Issues without parent Epic".
# Create an Epic outside plan.
# Ensure that "Parent field" is viewable in issue page.
# Edit the newly created issue and set the "Parent field" value to the Initiative which is available in the plan.
# Check the plan and the issue will still be missing.


h3. Environment

JIRA Portfolio 2.21.0


h3. Expected Results

Issue is added to the plan after parent field is set to the issue from issue page.


h3. Actual Results

Issue is not added to the plan after parent field is set to the issue from issue page.


h3.Workaround

# Create a new test Epic issue.
# Verify that the issue does not show in plan.
# Edit the Epic and set Parent link value.
# Access plan and verify that the issue does not show in plan.
# Edit the plan source.
# In Step 3, Click "Initiative" and find the missing Epic. Click it.
# Switch to "Epic" in same Step 3 and ensure that user click the missing Epic.
# After making this change, click "Done".
fields.summary: Issue is missing from Plan after setting the "Parent field" in issue page

fields.description:
The [Jira Core|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/7.12.0/], [Jira Service Desk|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira-servicedesk/REST/3.15.0/] and [Jira Software|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira-software/REST/7.3.1/] REST API documentation all share a similar design and format, and include examples.

In contrast, the [Portfolio REST API|https://docs.atlassian.com/portfolio-for-jira-server/REST/2.13.0/teams/] uses a difference format - and the documentation is either incomplete, or misleading. For example, looking at the "Entity creation operation" for the {{POST /team}} path, it looks like you can create the team and add members to it (as the whole team DTO is specified).

However, it's [not possible to create a team with members in a single call|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-2470], they must be added manually.
fields.summary: The REST documentation should be in the same format as existing API documentation

fields.description:
After changing the *username* of a user the old username is displayed when hovering over the avatar in the "Review Changes" dialog.

Steps to recreate:
 # Create a new user in Jira called "dave1"
 # Login to Jira as that user and view an existing Portfolio plan
 # Make a change to the plan
 # Click "Review changes" button and observe in the resulting dialog that the last change was made by the new user
 # Log out of Jira and log back in as the Administrator
 # Go to the "User management" tab and edit the previously created user
 # Change the *username* to "dave2" (leave all other settings the same)
 # Log out as the Administrator
 # Log in as "dave2" and view the same Portfolio plan
 # Make another change to the plan
 # Click the "Review changes" button
 # Hover over the avatar for the last change and not that it shows "dave1" and *not* "dave2" (i.e. the old username is displayed).
fields.summary: Old username displayed when reviewing changes after username updated

fields.description:
We are using Portfolio for Jira v2.18.0

With JIRA v7.6.4

 

We are using Portfolio plugin with 1 project and ~30 teams in that project.


We are facing this issue:

I have an EPIC, and I have 2 User Stories for that Epic.
I have 2 different teams assigned for the 2 different User Stories.

In Portfolio, it shows there are 2 teams assigned for the EPIC. ( It is calculated by the Portfolio plugin automatically)

We made Portfolio's Team custom field visible in JIRA also.
The problem is that when I open the Epic in JIRA, I can't see that 2 teams, only 1 or none of them.




We would like to use Portfolio's Team field in JIRA, but now because of this we had to create a separate custom Team field, and update it manually. It's not so convenient, and it also can create discrepancy...
fields.summary: Issue with Team field for Epic with multiple teams

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Scheduled Start and Scheduled End dates don't show up under the "Scope" tab of a program, but the plans under the program are scheduled and the "Schedule" tab shows that they are
h3. Environment

JIRA Portfolio 2.18 and above
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1) Configure a Portfolio program based on more than one Portfolio Plans (i.e. the program scope are the plans)

Hierarchy: Program -> Plan -> Epic - Story

2) Calculate Plan Scheduling for the plans - Notice that the Plan Schedules appear both under the "Schedule" and "Scope" tab

3) Now navigate to the Portfolio program and check "Scope" tab. Notice that "Scheduled Start" and "Scheduled End" column values are empty while the plans appear as scheduled under the "Schedule" tab
h3. Expected Results

Portfolio should consistently show that plans are scheduled both under the "Scope" and "Schedule tab"
h3. Actual Results

Actual results are inconsistent – some plans might "scheduled start" and "scheduled end" date, some will not
h3. Notes

This behaviour is due to an inconsistency in how Portfolio calculates the schedule dates of items in the 'schedule' tab vs the 'scope' tab. In the 'schedule' tab the calculation is taking into account the schedule dates of the child issues, whereas the 'scope' tab is not. That means that if you have an Epic that is not explicitly estimated (but has estimates on its children), you will see that Epic as scheduled in the 'schedule' tab but not the 'scope' tab.
h3. Workaround

Refer to the "Schedule" tab for scheduling information
fields.summary: Add "Target date" fields to the "Scope" tab of a program

fields.description:

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Target start/end fields are stored incorrectly on the Issue history.


h3. Environment
* user.timezone set to any "western" timezone (eg. America/Sao_Paulo)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set a Target end value
# Verify Issue history

h3. Expected Results
Issue history displays the same value specified

h3. Actual Results
Issue history displays the day before the date specified

h3.Solution / Workaround
# Set system user timezone to UTC at [Jira JVM properties|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/setting-properties-and-options-on-startup-938847831.html]
{noformat}-Duser.timezone=Etc/UTC{noformat}
#* (!) Note that different user and system timezones can result in the behavior described in JRASERVER-41646
# Restart Jira
fields.summary: Target start/end field depends on system user timezone

fields.description:
h5. Problem Definition
At the moment, the new plan experience mode is available for early access in current version of Portfolio (2.15.x and later). This new feature has its own filter options (and does not share it with the normal/old plan mode). The filter options are currently limited based on Project, Team, Release, Dependencies. 

h5. Suggested Solution
It would be great to carry over filter options from the old plan mode such as Status, and Completion date. This is also to give options to exclude resolved items.
fields.summary: New Experience mode to include existing scope filter options

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
We introduced Parent/Child Issues panel visible in Jira Issue View based on https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1357 However, there isn't any documentation in Portfolio for Jira Server explaining this in detail.

There is only Initiative explanation though missing parent/child details; https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver/configuring-initiatives-and-other-hierarchy-levels-802170489.html

h3. Suggested Solution
Create a documentation detailing the Jira Issue view of Parent/Child issues panel, including but not limited to the following
* Details found in Cloud doc - https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfoliocloud/showing-portfolio-custom-fields-in-jira-software-856708725.html
* Parent/Child panel appear on Initiative and Hierarchy usage
* Permission related to view/configure if any


h3. Why this is important
* Remove inconsistency between Cloud and Server documentation in which both features existed in both products
* Ensuring all introduced features in the respective product is documented for Support and Customers
fields.summary: Documentation to explain Parent and Child Issues in Portfolio

None.

fields.description:
For an example see the screenshot here: [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Portfolio-for-Jira-questions/Jira-Portfolio-Create-Plan-UI-Text/qaq-p/955589]

 

This happens because Portfolio uses a CSS class called "progress". Since "progress" is a common word, it is possible for a custom theme to apply styling for it.

 

To solve this, Portfolio should use a more specific CSS class. For example "jpo-progress".

fields.description:
h3. Summmary
Ordering CPR does not get reflected after reloading/refreshing the plan in certain situation.

h3. Steps to Reproduce 
# Create a plan. Issue sources are 3 projects (A, B, C)
# Create CPR releases for these projects (A, B, C), lets say CPR1 and CPR2
# Edit issue source, add 1 more project (D)
# Create CPR release for all projects (A, B, C, D), lets say CPRnew
# Current Order in plan: CPRnew | CPR1 | CPR2
# When CPR2 is ordered before CPR1, the change is being reflected once plan is reloaded. Which means it's now 
{code}
CPRnew | CPR2 | CPR1
{code}
# But when either CPR1 or CPR2 is ordered to be before CPRnew, the change is not being reflected once plan is reloaded.

h3. Expected Results

{code}
CPR2 | CPRnew| CPR1
{code}

h3. Actual Results
Even after committing the changes, the order will get reverted.

{code}
CPRnew | CPR2 | CPR1
{code}
fields.summary: Cross Project Releases not ranked properly

fields.description:
The JQL function childIssuesOf() is effective to get the full hierarchy from an Initiative and down. However it is way too limited as it will only get the children of one single specified issuekey. 

A normal use case would be when you have several Initiatives that belongs together and should be shown in the same plan. An example would be to create a plan with all Initiatives having a custom field "Function" set to the same value. In this case the childIssuesOf function is useless since you would need to specify every Initiative issue in the filter. 

The solution would be to use a functionality similar to the script runner linkedIssuesOf function where you could specify a subquery inside the parenthesis. 

For example _issuekey in childIssuesOf("Function = Audio")_ would be much, much more useful.
fields.summary: Add subquery to the JQL childIssuesOf function

fields.description:
The filtering possibilities in Portfolio today is really limited as you can only filter by Release, Project, Team and Status. 

As most companies have thousands of issues in the plan it is vital to be able to search by other parameters. Adding the possibility to filter by any custom field would much improve the visibility of the plan. 

Getting a functionality like the already exisiting "More" dropdown in the issue navigator would be really good for many users.
fields.summary: Make it possible to filter Scope by any custom field

fields.description:
Currently, in order to display issues in the timeline on Portfolio's New Planning Experience, it's necessary to set target start and end dates to issues, whereas the roadmap of the current experience displays issues either based on the release, story points or sprint dates.

It'd be nice to migrate that ability over to the new experience.
fields.summary: New Planning Experience - Display issues in timeline based on start and end dates of release or sprint

fields.description:
Unusual rounding error causing  sprint capacities to be shown incorrectly. 

For example 23.999998092651367 is shown instead of 24 and 55.99999237060547 is shown instead of 56
fields.summary: Rounding errors in sprint capacities

fields.description: When issues are created inline on the backlog of a board that references a particular team in its filter that team should automatically be set on the issue to ensure it remains visible on the board. This behaviour already exists for labels and components but is currently missing for the team custom field.
fields.summary: Automatically set field "Team" on issues when created in backlog that references a specific team in its filter

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In Portfolio, a user can gain access to view and edit a plan through two general means:
* By being designated as a Plan Editor in the Plan's permissions
* By being granted the Portfolio User permission in Portfolio's general permissions

However, these methods do not grant fully equivalent permissions and rights. Through either method a user will be able to view and edit a plan, but a user cannot create a Parent/Child link without the *Portfolio User* permission, as that permission is necessary to create and edit custom fields implemented by Portfolio.

h3. Environment
Jira Portfolio 2.17.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Initial Setup:

1. Create a brand new Software Project
2. Create a brand new Portfolio Plan based on said Project
3. Add a new Hierarchy Level above Epic, like in the following screenshot:
 !Portfolio Hierarchy.png|thumbnail! 

4. Create a brand new User, ensuring that they are properly licensed to use Jira Software

Permissions Setup:

# Add the new User as an Editor to the Plan Permissions
# Ensure the User does *not* have *Portfolio User* permission for Global Portfolio Permissions ([$JIRA_URL/secure/PortfolioPermissions.jspa])

Reproducing the Issue:

# Create a new Initiative 
# Create a new Epic
# Designate the Initiative as the parent of the Epic
# Commit

h3. Expected Results

If a user with these permissions is expected to be able to establish Parent Links, then the linkage should succeed.

Otherwise, an error/warning should be thrown in the UI prohibiting the User or otherwise warning them that the Link will not be possible.

h3. Actual Results
Parent Link is not established and no error or warning is thrown in the UI.

The following error is thrown in logs:
{code}2018-11-15 16:38:54,691 http-nio-8080-exec-9 WARN kliou92 998x3015x1 l373jd 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/jpo/1.0/issues/commit [c.a.r.j.customfields.parent.ParentCustomFieldHelper] Editability check for setting Portfolio parent link failed
{code}

h3. Workaround
Ensure that users who need to create Parent links have the Portfolio User permission, as Plan specific editor permissions are not enough to create these links.
fields.summary: Cannot create parent/child link in Portfolio without Portfolio User permission
Enabling new experience fails for some plans

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition

Currently issues are removed from a plan if they are in a Status of Done Category (Green).

_Exception: Issues that have Sub Tasks that are +not+ in the Done category will continue to display in the Plan until all Sub Tasks are in the Done category as well._ 
h3. Suggested solution

Issue Resolution should be used to determine whether issues are to be removed instead of Status.
h3. Why this is important

If issues are in a Green status but not resolved, they won't show up in the plan unexpectedly.
h3. Workaround

In version 2.22+, enable this dark feature:
{code:java}
com.atlassian.portfolio.issueloading.includeUnresolvedCompleted{code}
by adding it from <JIRA_BaseURL>/secure/SiteDarkFeatures!default.jspa
fields.summary: Plan should use Issue Resolution rather than Issue Status Category to determine when to remove issues

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently the  'person' Team Management REST API call does not provide the username of the user, it only provides the userkey of the user.

h3. Suggested Solution

Add the username in the response too. 
 
h3. Workaround 

Get the username of the user by running the following rest call:
{code}
rest/api/2/user?key=
{code}
where you will have to place the userkey at the end.

As you might be aware SAFe aligned organisations use the central hierarchy EPIC --> Feature --> Story.

fields.description:
I'd like to have the global availability interacting with team availability. so that when I set a global end date, I have the team availability terminated as well (or at least be prompted to have that done. Now, I have the global availability ended but the team, not affected. We need to manually change them all. 

On the other hand I'd love to have global capacity as well and have that related to the team availability and capacity. Example a person can work 8 (configurable) hours a day. Then, when planning that person in teams you can set up to 8 hours per day and any extra is highlighted (considered overtime). 

I want to have the global capacity linked to a specific portfolio as well, so that I know the total availability for the current projects and the free bookable capacity I can use for other projects.

It will be quite normal to be able to create separate portfolios as well. In the current portfolio there is no way to create portfolio - we are limited to plan and program. I am trying to manage two somehow related organisations with one portfolio and find this limiting, too.
fields.summary: Global availability to interact with team availability and implement global capacity

fields.description:
h3. Summary

With the default settings of date and time in Look & Feel and Advanced Settings, if the language is French, changes in Date fields can't be committed, but if the language is English, the same changes can be committed.

(i) This is known to affect _at least_ *Target start* field, and it doesn't matter whether it's the JIRA System language or User Profile language that is French.
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Ensure the following settings are default:
 ** {{jira.date.picker.java.format}} (Advanced Settings) - default is {{d/MMM/yy}} (changing to {{dd/MMM/yy}} doesn't help)
 ** {{jira.date.time.picker.java.format}} (Advanced Settings) - default is {{dd/MMM/yy h:mm a}}
 ** Day/Month/Year Format (Look and feel) - default is {{dd/MMM/yy}}
 ** Complete Date/Time Format (Look and feel) - default is {{dd/MMM/yy h:mm a}}
 # Change User Profile language to French
 # Edit *Target start* date field of 1 of the issues in Portfolio plan
 # Commit the changes

h3. Expected behavior

Changes are committed successfully
h3. Actual behavior

Changes can't be committed due to invalid date format:
{quote}Unable to commit
 Vous n'avez pas saisi de date valide. Veuillez saisir la date au format 'd/MMM/yy', par exemple, "25/sept./18".
{quote}
h3. Workarounds
 # Change the _*month*_ format of these 2 settings to *MM* from Advanced Settings:
 ** {{jira.date.picker.java.format}} to *{{dd/MM/yy}}*
 ** {{jira.date.time.picker.java.format}} to *{{dd/MM/yy h:mm a}}*
 # Temporarily use English instead of French as System/User language
fields.summary: Commit change in Portfolio fails due to Date format when using d/MMM/yy in French.

fields.description:
The  automatic search performed when typing an issue and which provides suggested items in the Parent Link field (Jira Portfolio Plugin)  works in a different way than when the same action is performed in the Epic Link field (Jira Agile).



h2. Additional Details
The way each automatic search works is detailed below.

h3. Parent Link  (Jira Portfolio Plugin)
* It only finds a valid suggestion if the complete term is specified and hence
* No partial search when specifying the project key 
* No highlighting when partially finding a suggestion
* It only highlights a term if it is the complete term and matches
* No partial search when specifying terms that are in the initiative's summary
* It uses an API request as {code}
http://localhost:8080/rest/greenhopper/1.0/epics?searchQuery=&projectKey=NKP&maxResults=100&hideDone=true&_=1538899315928
{code}

h3. Epic Link (Jira Agile)
* It searches and starts suggesting epics with a part of the issue key (for example with just the project key)
* It highlights what it matches (partial term) in the suggestion
* It can search for either the issue key or the Epic name field
* It does not search for the summary field
* It uses an API request as {code}
http://localhost:8080/rest/jpo/1.0/parent/suggest
{code}

h2. Expected behaviour

Ideally both searches would work in the same way, since these two fields have a similar functionality.
End users found that Epic Link search easier to use,  hence this feature request.
fields.summary: Make the type-in search in the Parent LInk field to work in the same way that Epic Link field (to keep consistency of Jira application across plugins)

fields.description:
I love using the Folio Staff page to indicate Sprint health.  During planning, I can see if users are over or under loaded, since we generally assign each task before deferral day.  Mid-sprint, I can see who needs help – who is falling behind – by how "red the bar is" that shows "assigned / overload" hours.  I think this is an under-advertised feature.

But this information is only helpful if users have logged their time.  Can we have a column (perhaps to the right of the staff member's bar graph for "assigned/available/overload") that indicates how stale the information is?  Perhaps something like "-8", to indicate 8 hours have passed without timesheet update... or maybe "32/40" to indicate that 40 hours have passed, but the total hours reported by the user (in all of the timesheets) is 8 hours behind.

I can provide screen captures if I haven't been clear.

!file:///C:/Users/weslkunz/AppData/Local/Temp/snap_screen_20180928083422.png!
fields.summary: Folio Staff Page: "Up to date" indication

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

As a Jira admin, I'd like to have the ability to create new tickets with custom fields directly from the Plan View
h3. Environment

Jira Software 7.12.2 with Jira Portfolio 2.17.1
h3. Expected Behavior

Jira Portfolio should allow you to create new tickets that have a custom field directly from the Plan View
h3. Actual Behavior

Jira Portfolio will open a new window asking you to insert the value from the required custom field even if you already inserted the value at the Plan View before committing
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new custom field
 # Configure this custom field as required
 # Associate field to the necessary screens
 # Go to the Portfolio Plan and create a new ticket directly from the plan view (as shown below)
 !creating_ticket.png|width=879,height=226!
 # Commit the change made
 # The portfolio will ask you to fill the same custom field that was created with a value in the plan view mode (as shown below)
 !required_field.png|width=963,height=484!
fields.summary: Have the ability to create new tickets with custom fields from Plan View

fields.description:
Portolio's Target Start and Target End fields can be added to a JQL search. When exporting the search to a CSV file, both fields are exported in a timestamp format (i.e. {{27/Sep/18 12:00 AM}}) using the system date field of Jira. However, both fields are date-only fields in the UI (the user doesn't have the option to pick the time, only the date).

In other words, the UI shows the date as UTC (date only) and exports it as the system timezone used by Jira (as date-time). This shifts the date into the previous day and causes confusion. 

 

*JQL Of Portfolio Dates*

!Target Start End.png|thumbnail!

*CSV Export*
{code:java}
Issue key,Issue id,Parent id,Status,Created,Updated,Custom field (rm.jpo.plan.common.baselineStart),Custom field (rm.jpo.plan.common.baselineEnd)

ANDY-3,10102,,To Do,11/Jun/19 12:57 PM,11/Jun/19 1:54 PM,17/Jun/19 7:00 PM,30/Jun/19 7:00 PM
ANDY-2,10101,,To Do,11/Jun/19 12:57 PM,11/Jun/19 1:54 PM,17/Jun/19 7:00 PM,30/Jun/19 7:00 PM
ANDY-1,10100,,To Do,11/Jun/19 12:57 PM,11/Jun/19 1:54 PM,17/Jun/19 7:00 PM,30/Jun/19 7:00 PM{code}
In this specific example, Central Daylight Time (CDT) is 5 hours behind of Universal Time Coordinated (UTC), so the export is 5 hours behind, changing the date that is displayed in the UI and causing confusion.

 

*Expected behaviour.*
 Only the date field should be exported to CSV without any shifts in hours/timezones.
fields.summary: Target Start and End fields are exported with timezone shift

fields.description:
h3. Summary
For the Target start date and Target end date field, even if you enter the correct value, the following error will occurred:
{code}
Target start date must be before target end date
{code}
The validation rule will try to compare the previous end date if there is any against the new start date therefore this behaviour is incorrect.

initially has 4/Sep/18 as start and 12/Sep/18 as the end. Then he/she is trying to set start as 24/Sep/18 and end as 28/Sep/18. This is failing because the validation rule is comparing the previous end date (which is 12/sep/18) against the new start date (which is 24/sep/18). This is a bug

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.x 
* Portfolio 2.17.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add the Target start date and Target end date field in the create and edit issue screen
# Set 4/Sep/18 as the target start date
# Set 12/Sep/18 as the target end date
# Save it
# After that edit it and change the target start date to 24/Sep/18 and target end date to 28/Sep/18

h3. Expected Results
The changes will be saved successfully

h3. Actual Results
The below exception occurred:
{noformat}
Target start date must be before target end date
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
This behaviour only occurred if there is any previous value in these field.

h3.Workaround
The workaround for this is to set the end date first (in our case set it as 28/sep/18) and save it and then set the start date as 24/sep/18 and save again.
fields.summary: "Target start date must be before target end date" error occurred even if is the correct value

fields.description: We currently estimate using story points for teams using Kanban. However Jira Portfolio only allows estimation by time for Kanban. Please can this be updated to allow story points for Kanban estimation.
fields.summary: Use story points for estimating in Kanban teams

fields.description:
As a team leader I would like to provide estimated variable resource allocations to the projects my team is working toward.

We are planning resources 3 months ahead on an approximation basis, and at the moment we either provide current resource allocation, or an average of the coming 3 months, neither provide sufficient details for the project leaders.

If it was possible to add resource forecasting to Portfolio that would show increasing velocity in the coming months, that would be incredibly useful for our organization. This could also enable the project leader to investigate scenarios where he could request additional resources from our team and thus find a solution to his timing issues.
fields.summary: Predicted variable capacity

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Hiding Affects Version and/or Fixed Version in a Jira field configuration for a specific project and/or issue type will cause the relating issues not to appear it Portfolio plans.

Ideally Portfolio would provide an alert visible in Portfolio plan if this condition occurs with instructions on how to resolve this ( Affects Version and Fixed Version are required to be shown and cannot be hidden )


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 3 hierarchy levels, we can use Program -> Project -> Epic as an example
# Create a field configuration tied to Project issue type:
 !field-configuration.png|thumbnail! 
# Hide Affects Version and Fix Version so they don't appear when viewing an issue:
 !project.png|thumbnail! 
# Observe this issue is missing in the relating Portfolio plan
 !plan.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Portfolio provides an alert that the affected issue won't be viewable in the Plan view as Affects Version/Fix Version are not accessible 

h3. Actual Results
No indication is given that there's a problem with the underlying Jira project configuration
 
h3. Notes
To fix the underlying issue go into the field configuration and make Affects Version/Fix Version visible by selecting show. This will make these fields visible when viewing the affected issue:
 !project-fixed.png|thumbnail! 

And ultimately visible in Portfolio once more:
 !plan-fixed.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Hiding Affects Version or Fixed Version in a Jira Field Configuration causes unexpected behavior in Portfolio plan

fields.description:
Hi,

When we are planning, we would like to:
 * be able to filter per epic
 * be able to group the stories per epic
 * be able to show the stories of a particular epic under the epic planning view
fields.summary: Filtering and grouping on planning per epic

fields.description:
Hi,

It's currently possible to define team level availability, but the exceptions are at the individual level. This is I think a problem, at least for us, since we do have our teams doing sometimes new developments and sometimes pure maintenance sprints. 

We tried to define the exceptions for the maintenance weeks to each and every one, but it's a lot of work and error prove, so now we end up to have an exception at the plan level, but then we can't have any exception for a person that would continue his development work and won't do any maintenance during a sprint.

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver/configuring-the-availability-of-team-members-814212629.html]
fields.summary: Portfolio - team level availability & exceptions

fields.description: The release report does not show releases in a sorted (by release date) order, which makes the report hard to view.
fields.summary: Release Report Should be Sorted

fields.description: Current problem is that themes live only in portfolio. we would like to see themes also in Jira so we can make it visible on the issues itself directly and also within Dashboard gadgets
fields.summary: I am using Portfolio to set Themes.  However we would like to see themes also within Jira and not only in portfolio.

fields.description: Currently when I add multiple issues for my team, it requires me to input a required field specifying the responsible team; this is prompted on every issue I am committing changes to. Could it be possible to add a feature where I can do something like bulk edit while committing?
fields.summary: As a team leader I want to bulk set a required field for all issues I've created using Portfolio to remove repetitive selection

fields.description: I would like to have a scenario plan report, that shows the major changes that took place in this scenario and maybe a text area where I can add my own color to what a scenario is supposed to accomplish.
fields.summary: More Verbose Scenario Planning

fields.description:
I would love a report that shows what releases are at risk with specific suggestions.

For example:  You are deficient in skills X,Y,Z and if you hired X amount of folks with the following skills you could derisk.

Would be powerful for scenario planning
fields.summary: Skills and Staffing Deficiency Report

fields.description: The release report should be sorted based on delivery date.   My releases are out of order visually which makes it hard to present.
fields.summary: Release Report should be sorted

fields.description: I would like to option to show a % instead of days in capacity report, helps with senior management messaging.
fields.summary: Option to Show % instead of Days in Capacity Report

fields.description:
I would like to be able to add milestones (vertical flags) on a schedule.

For example, I have a specific customer install or release install that I want to call out in the schedule.
fields.summary: Support for Milestones in Schedule
Portfolio Plan API: Expose Teams instead of Plan Teams

fields.description: think of a function that allows me to overlap two scenarios and understand the differences between them
fields.summary: what difference between two (or more) scenarios ?

fields.description: very often it happens that the name of the project is not well understood. I ask you is it possible to make the left side of the screen resizable in portfolio for jira so that you can see the full project name?
fields.summary: show full name of project

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce
 # Create two scrum projects in Jira – Project A and Project B
 # Create backlog items for each project
 # Create, but do not start, sprints for each project
 # Create a Portfolio plan containing both projects; use the boards as the source data
 # Start the first sprint for Project A with a start date in the prior week
 # Calculate to refresh the plan

Expected results: In the plan, the first sprint for Project B should have a start date on the current date as it has not been started in Jira.

Actual results: In the plan, the first sprint for Project B is starting on the same date as Project A started even though it has not been started.

Note: May be related to JPOSERVER-1293
fields.summary: Start date for sprint is in the past for un-started sprints when plan contains a board with a started sprint

fields.description:
We are using Tempo for time tracking and have each team with named Jira resources in the teams. 

 

It would be GREAT if you integrated to Tempo teams.
fields.summary: Integration to Tempo Teams

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently Target dates are only available at the Plan level, it would be useful to have Target Start and End dates be visible on the Program level as well.
fields.summary: Target Start and End dates on Programs

fields.description:
When moving an epic that has, for example, 72 stories, it takes 25 seconds in Portfolio however the application freezes and doesn't show any loading message, which confuses the users that might cancel the page during the loading process.

It would be nice to have a loading message or icon during the process.
fields.summary: Loading message when moving epics

fields.description:
h3. Summary
We were informed that Plan API is read-only at this stage. Requesting that creation will become available in the upcoming API changes.
fields.summary: Allow portfolio plan creation via Java API

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently, for users with Portfolio Admin permission without JIRA Admin permission will not be able to navigate to Portfolio administration pages. However, they can access the pages by accessing the direct URL.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Assign a user with application access to Portfolio Administrator permission. Make sure this user is not a JIRA Administrator.
# Login as this user and try accessing Portfolio Administration.

h3. Expected Results
The user should be able to navigate to all the Portfolio Administration pages.

h3. Actual Results
The user is directed to the Portfolio Permission page and then, there is no possible way to access the other Portfolio Administration pages.

h3.Workaround
Since the pages are available for the user to be accessed, we can create links on [Application Navigator|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/creating-links-in-the-application-navigator-938847008.html]:
* Portfolio Permissions: <base URL>/secure/PortfolioPermissions.jspa
* Portfolio License Details: <base URL>/secure/PortfolioLicenseDetails.jspa
* Portfolio Hierarchy Configuration: <base URL>/secure/PortfolioHierarchy.jspa
* Portfolio Dependencies: <base URL>/secure/PortfolioDependencySettings.jspa
* Portfolio Beta Features: <base URL>/secure/PortfolioLabs.jspa

(i) Replace <base URL> with the respective value.
fields.summary: As a Portfolio Admin, I should be able to access the administration section of Portfolio via UI

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, Portfolio (or JIRA is general) does not allow users to set start dates for future Sprint. If a board has multiple future Sprints, it'll be started according to the created date order. 

Some users would like an ability to plan which Sprint that should be started is custom order from Portfolio. For example, if the board contains 5 Sprints, the user would like an ability to set custom start date for each Sprint so each Sprint will be started in custom order.


h3. Suggested Solution

Allow the user to set a custom start date for the future Sprint either from the board or Portfolio.

h3. Workaround 

None
fields.summary: Allow user to configure Sprint start date from Portfolio

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currrently it' possible to use Business project with Portfolio. When a user tried to access the *View version* from the version which is retrieved from the Business project, JIRA will be displaying a broken link page. This happens because Portfolio redirect a user to Release page which is only available on board and board is not available for the Business project.

+How to replicate problem+

# Create a business project.
# Create 3 versions in the project.
# Create a new Portfolio plan which includes the Business project and the 3 versions.
# Access the new Portfolio plan.
# Click on *Releases* and click on the version from the Business project.
# Click *View version* and JIRA will show broken link page.


h3. Environment

JIRA 7.11 & JPO 2.15


h3. Expected Results

Portfolio redirects user to the business project's version page


h3. Actual Results

Portfolio redirects users to a non-existent project which causes JIRA to display a broken link page.


h3.Workaround

Manually access the versions page from the affected project page.
fields.summary: Broken version link when Business project is used

fields.description:
As a Program Manager, I would like to be able to create multiple programs that contain the same or subsets of Plans as other programs, so that I can see the same information in different views depending on my perspective.


This is helpful when using the Schedule View to communicate with front of house teams who have varying concerns across different plans.

Interim workaround: Create duplicate plans with the same Filter.
fields.summary: Allow Plans to be part of more than 1 Program

fields.description:
We currently have several initiatives that contain stories which are independent or small enough that they are not tied to an Epic.

However, while using Portfolio, it seems like the only way to see these under the initiative are by tying then to an Epic which makes us create dummy epics just for these

It would be good to have ability to add stories directly to initiatives so that we can view both epics and stories under initiatives (kind of like where a portfolio can contain programs and projects and not every project is part of a program)
fields.summary: As a PM, I would like to see the ability to link Stories to Initiatives
Fixed start releases can delay multi-project plans

fields.description: When trying to assign a parent ticket to our QA team (one estimate) and Dev teams are working on sub-task the system will not allow this.  This is a current impediment to fully utilizing this product
fields.summary: Parent and subtask issue types should allow for separate team

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The Cloud and server Documents for configuring team member avaliability both focus on different sections and are missing the alternate portion

The Server Doc:
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver/configuring-the-availability-of-team-members-814212629.html
** Contains Details of the settings under the Teams tab only

The Cloud Doc:
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfoliocloud/configuring-team-members-availability-828785286.html
** Contains details on the settings under the People Tab Only


h3. Suggested Solution
Both Sections are available on each platform and the configuration settings need to be present on both platforms
 
h3. Workaround
The Information for configuration is the same for each platform with the exception of visual differences in the screenshots, but navigation options and settings line up and can be used on either platform until the data is added to each location
fields.summary: Missing details on portfolio Docs Cloud & Server

fields.description:
Hi 

So my business has some issues that aren't all categorised into EPICS, and of which will sometimes be a higher priority to work on than an EPIC.

To have this reflected in Jira Portfolio isn't possible at the moment and is causing us to not use the feature because of it.

 I am unable to drag a story above an EPIC in Portfolio, and have it shown visually.
fields.summary: Ability to prioritise a story over an EPIC in Portfolio

fields.description:
In Portfolio Server  it would be nice to not only see the dependencies when I hover over an epic (like cloud does):

 !image-2018-08-02-14-31-10-802.png|thumbnail! 

It would also be neat if those issues listed as dependencies were hyper links.
fields.summary: Show dependencies with links in timeline

fields.description:
h2. Summary

After upgrading to Portfolio 2.13 opening a plan as the plan onwer or a user that has permissions to edit the plan will fail with the below errors.

The issue will only happen if the plan has custom fields configured in \{{http://HOST:PORT/secure/PortfolioPlanView.jspa?id=237&sid=235#settings/custom-fields}} and these custom fields are displayed in the scpope view.
The bug was reproduced with a radio button custom field at the time it was created. It is not known if it will reproduce with other custom field types.

h3. Internet Explorer Errors

!PS25606_ErrorasPlanOwner_IE_290718_amended.png|thumbnail!


h3. Firefox Errors

!PS25606_ErrorasPlanOwner_Firefox_290718_amended.png|thumbnail!


h3. Additional details

Please note that other users that are not owners of the plan or that do not have edit permissions will be able to open it without any errors.


h2. Environment

* Jira Portfolio 2.13 or 2.14. or 2.14


h2. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a plan in Jira Portfolio 2.11 with one or more radio button custom fields configured and visible in the scope view.
# Add users with edit read permissions to the plan.
# Make the custom file visible in the scope view.
# Upgrade to Jira Portfolio 2.13 or 2.14 or 2.15.
# Open the plan as the user owning the plan

h2. Expected Results

The owner of the plan as well as users with edit permissions are able to open the plan.


h2. Actual Results

Opening the plan as the plan onwer or a user that has permissions to edit the plan fails with the errors shown in the description section of this bug.

h2. Workaround

h3. Workaround #1

You can hide the column from the plan scope view as shown below. It is important to note that once the field is hidden it will not be possible to set it back into the scope view as that will fail with the same error than when opening the plan. 
It is possible to enable the field back performing that operation as one of the users with read-only permissions.

!PS25606_Workaround1.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround #2

The custom field from the plan's configuration can be removed as shown below.

!PS25606_Workaround2.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: After upgrading to Portfolio 2.13 opening a plan (as the owner of it) fails with an error

fields.description:
Currently, users can filter plan by project, team, release but not by board.

Use case: a company has a few departments which each work differently on the same actions. Some teams use deeper levels of hierarchy like initiatives, epics, stories, but some are not familiar with Jira or just don't need any deeper levels than their action. 

What teams want to see: their own actions and its progress.
What C-levels want to see: a plan which can be filtered easily (not grouped) by team.

The possible solutions:
1/ Resolve JPOSERVER-223 :assign multiple teams to one issue, show a board for each team and the plan to C-levels with filtering by team. 

2/ Each team is a component. Actions can be related to several components. Make a board for each team (component), and create a plan with all boards. This will auto-create the teams. For C-level: +ability to filter by board.+

 

Thank you for reading!
fields.summary: Ability to filter plan by board
